# Definition of terms {#definition-of-terms}

**clay**: a soil material which can be reshaped or molded when moist and which retains develops high strength when dry

**clay-size**: an individual mineral grain which settles in through a column of fluid at the same rate as a spherical particle having 2 &mu;m diameter

**sand**: a soil material which is predominantly composed of mineral particles having sieve diameters between 53 and 2000 &mu;m

**packing fraction**: the volume fraction occupied by solids, normalized to the total soil volume (1-void fraction); $V_{s}$

**void fraction**: the volume fraction _not_ occupied by solids, normalized to the total soil volume (1-packing fraction); $V_{v}$
